Is it because it would be really slow to do any actual computation?

If so, why is it reasonably fast to do rational arithmetic inside tactics?

I ask because I'm working on a tactic that does a lot of stuff with rational numbers and I want to understand whether it is viable to put withTransparency .allanywhere where I want rationals to unify.
the implementation of Rat is optimized for execution, not kernel computation
you should use norm_num to prove equalities of rational numbers
Is there a reason we can't have both, via csimp?
Sebastian Zimmer has marked this topic as resolved.
